threads.name: PageantAnon
threads.com:
Welcome to the 4th annual Mr. /mlp/ollo competition! Earlier this month, we completed Miss /mlp/ 2022, in which the beloved, dreamwalking, royal moon-mare Luna managed to win it all, and now we look for who shall be the prince to Luna's princess. Last year Mr. /mlp/ollo was a man who made significant strides in making our waifus real with the power of artificial intelligence, the AI voice pioneer 15. But it's a brand new year and a brand new contest: the search for the number one guy of the board begins.
NOTE: Due to the slower nature of Mr. /mlp/ compared to Miss /mlp/, and combined with the shorter voting periods for this year, multiple rounds could pass over a single thread. So if you check this thread after Sunday, be sure to search below for any new forms.gle links leading to Qualifiers or even the first few Rounds of the tournament.

Now, for the nominations. As with last year, we will cap out at 128, though if we don't hit 128 nominations then 64 will do just fine. At present, these are the rules for entry:
1. Your character must obviously be MALE or if their gender is unconfirmed, obviously coded male.
2. GR15 must apply to them. This includes:
-Any and all guys who appear in an official MLP product licensed by Hasbro, which includes all of the main show 'Friendship is Magic', any of the G5 series/specials/film, Equestria Girls, the Movie, Pony Life, the IDW comics, the manga, the chapter books, and so forth.
-MLP OC's are also permitted, be they OC's representing the staff/audience, popular fanfic OC's, or fandom creations
-Characters from /mlp/ exclusive shows such as Filly Funtasia or Them's Fighting Herds
-Ponies from previous Gens before G4
In short: if it would get you a ban if you posted it anywhere but /mlp/, it's probably eligible. There may be a few gray areas here and there so if you feel like something should or shouldn't qualify, feel free to speak up.
2b. Characters who are not banned on other boards but have significant enough board presence on /mlp/ or memes associated with the fandom may be allowed. If you think such a character qualifies, please offer an explanation in your post as to why.
3. Alternate versions of existing characters (i.e. Nightmare Moon, Mean Twilight, etc.) may be nominated, but they may only participate in the tournament if they score more points than their original counterpart during the Qualifier round. Otherwise, no more alternates may proceed if their original has more votes in Qualifiers.
3b. Exceptions can and will be made for certain alternates deemed distinct or unique enough from the original to qualify as their own character. A second part of the Qualifier poll will be added to include all alternates suggested with a simple 'Yes/No' vote whether to make them verified alternates or not, and those that are verified will be able to proceed to the tournament even if they do not succeed their original in votes.

All of those things you listed are not exclusively human traits. Higher intelligence? Sure, we've yet to meet another intelligent species, but it'd be narcissism to claim that another species is "human-like" just because it exhibits higher intelligence. Foals are neotenous because guess what? Babies, even foals are usually baby-faced. What a concept, right? Also, any animal can eat fucking food the same way humans do because while animals do not have the same dietary needs, they can still eat human food if it fits within those dietary needs since everything that isn't a plant or fungus eats. You're also comparing apples to oranges with the foal example since human eyes, no matter what, are still small throughout a human's lifespan while a foal eventually grows into having larger eyes as an adult.

In short: The only thing you can argue is even close to humans is their intelligence. Even then, that'd be assuming there isn't intelligent life in the universe, which hasn't been completely proven yet since we haven't explored outside our own solar system. >What is Flutterrape?
Flutterrape is a collection of stories about ponies trying and failing to have sex with Anon, the only human in Equestria. While the title implies that it is Fluttershy trying to rape Anon, others may follow in her stead and attempt their own versions of rape. There are different versions of Flutterrape, but most are light-hearted comedies about the ponies failing in their attempts to get into Anon’s pants. Just because your story has Anon in it, doesn't mean it fits in this thread. Check other threads (AiE, RGRE etc) about story content before posting.

>It's been 10 years, how is this thread still alive?
A perverse mixture of necromancy and spite.

>How do I start writing?
Use your imagination, you nitwit. Additionally, brush up on your grammar and abandon your standards.

Writing Guides:
Clever Dick's Tips For Short Stories -- https://ponepaste.org/1274
Driverbang's Writing Guide -- https://ponepaste.org/1275
Navarone's Writing Rules -- https://ponepaste.org/1276

For additional information, lurk. You could also check out the T:EM/P/O threads for further writing advice, unless it's dead.
So many threads have died, but only Flutterrape has remained. We shall always remain. We are bound to the fate of the board as a lich is bound to its phylactery.

NEET/Misfit Pone is a thread for ponies who despite their best efforts (or in some cases complete lack thereof) struggle to fit in with the rest of society.

• Slice of life stuff.
• Lots of odd cute ponies becoming the waifu stories.
• Lots of being the cute oddball pony stories.
• A few NEET-recovery stories.
• A lot of smut, if you're into that.
• Lots of ponies to get you started with a variety of personalities and quirks. Don't like one of them? Give another NEET a try!
• Much, much more!

>Quick rundown on the pre-existing ponies ITT:
Floor Bored - The OG OC NEET from the very first threads. Floor comes in all different forms, but she's typically portrayed as a horny and kinda dirty mare most of the time. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2321489)
Pardise Skies - Paradise is a pony who started off as a NEET but ends up going to univeristy in a PiE setting. She's very quiet, easily spooked, likes to wear clothes and speaks with a stutter. (https://derpibooru.org/images/2289220)

Wallflower Blush, of Equestria girls fame but as a pone. (https://derpibooru.org/images/1658572)

Anon Mare - Anon Mare is entirely up to your own interpretation. Same premise as Anon Filly but all grown up. The self-insert pony.
Writer's Block - A NEET pony whos background is currently unclear. Know anything about her? Let us know ITT (https://derpibooru.org/images/2561414)

Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

>Caught.
>Caught red handed.
>The tiredness in your body seeps outwards, replaced with the cold chill of icewater flowing up your spine.
>Your own reflection gave you away. The world spins gently, and you feel as though the air was just punched out of your lungs.
>She's saying something now, but you can't hear. Your ears are filled with an overpowering ringing.
>It takes a tremendous effort to not immediately begin hyperventilating.
>Still, the excess energy has nowhere to go, and your extremities start to twitch and shake in anxiety.
>Every muscle fiber in your body is dialed up to 11, ready to explode into action.
>Heart pumping, lungs filling, blood rushing.
>Fight or flight mode : activated.
>You brace yourself, and prepare to...
>Reality snaps back into place. You're sitting in an undersized school chair, in a nearly empty classroom.
>There is no danger. Get a fucking grip Anon, you're losing it.
>You swallow. Again. Hard. Your mouth and throat are dry.
>Alright. No fight, and probably no flight. You opt to do a restless leg bounce instead.
>You still feel tense. The light in the room feels harsh, and you're quickly developing a splitting headache.
>Twilight is staring at you expectantly, and the worry in her eyes is obvious.
>She knows, yes, but she doesn't *know*.
>"Anon!"
>Her yell registers, and your muscles preemptively flex in readiness to run.
>"You aren't listening. This isn't like you, and I-"
"I'm fine."
>The words are dry, an ingrained mechanical response to danger.
>You feel bad cutting her off, but you would feel worse letting her continue.
>"What? You still aren't listening, I asked if you-"
"Really. I'm fine."
>The words are forced out of you with great effort. She remains unconvinced.
>What's worse, your words seem to have had the opposite desired effect. She's watching you carefully now.
>The occasional twitch of a hind leg or flick of the tail letting you know she's on edge too.
>Think, Anon, think. How can you get out of this situation, and fast?

>>39348817
>Why did you keep writing?
Several reasons. For context, I got on the ride late and haven't been writing that long in the grand scheme of things.
At first I wrote because I wanted to contribute to my favorite threads and it was nice chasing the new writer (You)s. Then life got more busy with more and more irl things demanding more of my time, so my output tapered off. By that point I was hooked on writing, something I had hated doing for most of my life. As writing requires very little in terms of equipment and can be done just about anywhere, it's become the only hobby I'm able to do with any kind of consistency.
Since my time is limited I decided that if I'm going to write, I might as well take it seriously (in the sense that I'm always striving to improve), but not too seriously; gotta still have fun at the end of the day. That said, I don't plan on writing horse words forever, but there are stories that I want to tell before I hang up my /mlp/ writefag hat and move on to writing about different things.
That's what keeps me going these days- I have several stories that need to be told for the characters' sake. I want to see them progress through their arcs, try, fail, try again, until they emerge on the other side different than they were before. Storytelling is fascinating, especially when you focus on the characters. Interesting plots are great and all, but if you don't have compelling characters to place in that plot, the story lacks the emotional weight needed to make the reader get invested.
I enjoy putting flawed characters in situations that play off their weaknesses to see what happens. Outcomes can get messy, especially when characters give in to their base desires despite trying to the "right thing" most of the time. I like to explore what happens when characters start down a slippery slope. Can they course-correct and regain their footing, or do they have to slide all the way to rock bottom before they get their shit together? Does a "good" character become bad/evil if they deliberately choose the wrong thing? How about if they continue to do the "wrong" thing? Do you dismiss their plight outright, or can you look outside of your own moral lens to empathize? Do you even have all the details to cast an objective judgment as you're going through the journey with a character? Did a character chose the "wrong" course of action whilst in a mentally/emotionally distressed state? If so, how does it change your perception of his/her actions? This is stuff I think about when I write, though I'm more interested in seeing what happens after mistakes are made rather than contemplating the morality of said mistakes ad nauseam.
Thank you for attending my blogpost, more Spitfire in a few hours.

threads.com:
Howdy, partner!

What you see here began as a series of comedy-centric stories with the concept of an alicorn-ascended Princess Applejack trying to change a mismanaged Equestria for the better by humorously interacting with the other, quite lazy, princesses. Plus late night pink antics.

Not to mention a whole bunch of Changelings with nothing better to do but cause mischief.


The whole thing was set in motion by this gem:

~~~~~

>So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

>Because you seem to be the only goddamn one of those ponies who gets that a Princess need to do actual work regarding maintenance of the kingdom. You know how much city planning or trade negotiations Twilight or Luna have done? Fucking nothing. Everyone is obsessed with the world ending threats they think I should fight, but the minute I point out the free health care I have to work to maintain everyone goes quiet. And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. Go do actual princess stuff, because apparently everyone else got the pamphlets mixed up or something and thinks "Princess" means "Beat cop."

~~~~~

Are you feeling creative? Try your hand at writing a story! No contribution is too small and we love having new folks around.

If you're more artistically inclined give a drawing or sketch a shot. Don't fret too much; it doesn't have to be fancy and we appreciate artwork a lot.

If that isn't your style either, writers always need feedback. So tell us what you liked - and what you didn't - to help us improve.

If you are unsure about anything, do not be afraid to ask. We will gladly bring you up-to-date or explain anything you feel is unclear.

Thread 354, and we've got turkey galore!

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
This will be deleted so it'll be quick. Today's an exceptionally special day as it marks 10 years since Milky Way's Tumblr started. The tumblr is now age-restricted but you can view the posts here starting from the back: https://www.tumbex.com/milkmare-of-trottingham.tumblr/posts?page=10

Milky's special talent quickly gained the blog over 1400 watchers in less than two weeks. It was especially embraced on /mlp/ where the thread generated several times more content than the tumblr which was only in its second day: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/5678650/#q5678650 Milky had a continuous presence for months afterwards as a general thread.

Fast forward to May 2013 and it was on its 71st general thread: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/10866090/#q10866090 The thread was deleted early and the incident shrugged off, but unbeknownst to them it was right before some of the most eventful days in /mlp/ history. Lauren Faust would visit /mlp/ a few days later https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/ and all hell broke loose, even prompting a reply from Moot (https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/500/3/#q10906860). But attention quickly turned to "The Scruffening", a mass deletion of various threads and general confusion over the following days. Milky Way threads were quickly deleted from then on, later confirmed as bannable content due to its NSFW nature: https://desuarchive.org/q/thread/640332/#q641855 Some claimed that Lauren's visit sparked the sudden SFW enforcement but this remains inconclusive.

Milky Way threads have occasionally been posted over the years, lasting only a few minutes to several hours at a time. While the blog's creator remains active (https://twitter.com/FlashEquestria), the blog itself hasn't had a new post in a year.

Not expecting a discussion here. This one's for the archives.

threads.sub: Rainbow Dash is Too Much of a Tomboy
threads.com:
The idea that Sunset and Applejack are as masculine as Rainbow Dash is laughable. They are much more mellow and have much more feminine traits so that their friendships with the others still feels natural, they doesn't come off as the token tomboy like Rainbow Dash does.

Rainbow Dash has the personality of a typical loud male jock and yet she is friends with feminine girls who have completely different temperaments and interests than her. She has never been shown with tomboy or male friends that have her type of temperament. She comes off as a forced token tomboy character. Like really, they couldn't give her a single male friend? She has the masculine temperament of guys, so it seems like she would have definitely have male friends. Heck, she acts a lot more like your average male than your average female.

Where are her friends that are not vastly different from her? I'm not even necessarily asking for the same interests, just for a similar temperment. The rest of them are all chill normies in spite of varying interests while Rainbow is just alone as the loud brash hyper dude bro. And yet she magically is on the same footing as the rest as best friends, and appears to have no other close friends. If you had a jock friend who acted like Rainbow Dash but is a male, would you be able to see them as best friends with people with the mane six's temperment? Of course not.

In a real life setting like high school or college, what group of people could you more naturally see Rainbow Dash hanging out and bonding with: A group of brash, mascaline troublemakers (whether male or tomboys) who are athletic and enjoy screwing around, or the feminine safe mane six? You know the answer to this question deep down in spite of all the mental gymnastics you use to deny it. The Mane Six are too attitudinally safe and unfun for her. Her placement in the show is forced and has always been forced. But people don't care because they like tomboys. Which is fair enough, but you still gotta acknowledge this blatant flaw even if it does not personally bother you.

Okay, I couldn't work on it today, but I still tested out a process to apply translations.
It will be a mess to organize and manage it myself, someone (preferably the previous Anon) must take the translation management task.

As a lingofaggot, your job is to:
- Call for local Anons to translate (and/or check) various languages,
- Manage (or use tools to) the translation in different languages,
- Archive translations in an open, usable, format (like Json, txt, or whatever),
- Edit the resources when needed (and if local anons can't do it),
- Produce the SWF file when a translation is finished and checked.

So far, I could gather part of Spanish, Portuguese, Swedish, Russian and French translations.
But the system needs to be updated and consolidated into easier to share format.
For example, in addition to the core game, Spanish have some graphical buttons and extra strings translated, but other languages don't have that, and some (like French) don't have much translated.
The best would be for the Anon whom set up https://explore.transifex.com/testt57y56h56u/bfed2/ to come back.

So, who's gonna be the lingofaggot we need?

>>39351829
I honestly don't think there's much naturality in it, it's really just practice. Reading helps, writing helps more, both are important. It's really a skill you can - and have to - just grind out. Write mediocre stories, take feedback, write something better, etc.

Sometimes people slap out some story and it's actually really decent and they go "yeah this is my first story please be gentle", and all you can think is that damn, it may have flaws, but it's entirely readable and even interesting and you enjoyed it and it's nothing like you'd be able to get if you tried to string words together.
But the truth is most people have garbage that they throw away. Or I don't know, maybe I'm projecting, but I am reasonably confident in asserting that generally speaking, almost nobody's "first story that turned out really well" is ever actually really the first thing they wrote, ever (or since high school or something).

A concept that didn't work out, so you jot down a couple thousand words and see that it's shit. You try to figure out how to improve it, then abandon and later try something else. Maybe another one of those, or a couple more.
A draft, with a new concept, that you slept on for two days, then realised the ways in which it's shit and made it better.
A friend who pre-reads your now-revised draft and points out some more things you can improve.
A "first story" is born, of surprisingly high-quality. What of the first concepts that got thrown away, never finished? Writing practice, but don't actually "count" as a story. What of the draft that got 90% rewritten? It's the same story, so it also doesn't count. But nobody puts their pen to paper and just shits out a high-quality story with zero prior experience.

And of course even competent first stories are almost never, ever masterpieces. They're usually good "for a first story". Decent at best otherwise.

And finally, if you want to write greentext, in many ways it's a lot easier: the formulaic nature means you barely have to worry about your prose. You just need to have a story to tell, with sequences of stuff that happens. You can focus entirely on making good, believable characters, and an interesting plot, and greentext lets you essentially just convey that with minimum effort.

“None. We’re hoofing it up to an old railway tomorrow. Rainbow takes point with navigation again.”
>Twilight looks utterly miserable upon hearing this news, but says nothing
>Even though you pulled the cart today, you could tell that she was suffering from the trek
>You felt so bad watching her climb one particularly steep hill that you nearly offered to let her ride alongside Rainbow
>Even now, a long sweat stain dries down the middle of Twilight’s green Sisterhood cloak, from neck to tail
>”Mater wills it so.”
>Twilight does her trademark little curtsy of deference, and steps outside just as you step in
>Inside the station, a wide array of dials, buttons, and labels stretches across a long panel, most of which are beyond your expertise
>One thing you do recognize, however, is the microphone, which you promptly move towards
>Nearby is a pair of very old-looking headphones, which you take the time to strap around your ears and chin
>FZZZZZZZZZZZZT
>You wait
>And wait
>The static buzz doesn’t make the waiting any easier
>Until finally…
>{“Applejack? App(fzzzz)ack, is that you?”}
>And just like that, your eyes are wet
>The sound of your Granny’s voice, muffled but recognizable, fills you with a feeling you can’t begin to describe
>It may as well have been years since you heard it, rather than mere weeks
>All that’s come to pass, all this Mission has in store for you
“Granny. I-I’m here, Granny.”
>{“Applejack. Oh, Applejack. Praise be to (fzzzzzzzz)ter for you. Where are you, swee(fzzzzz)?”}
“It’s a long story. But I’ve got all night.”

last_replies.name: Anonymous

>>39350545
You don't mix Latin and Greek roots when devising scientific terms.
>"-ology" comes from the Greek word _logos_,
>"hippo-" comes from the Greek word _hippos_.
>"equin-" comes from the Latin word _equus_.
So, the correct term is "hippology".
